page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content:
The principal feature of the area is{ {Norland Moor.}This is a fairly level high plateau of unenclosed moorland and heathland.
On the western side, running south to north, is the{Ryburn Valley.}The River Ryburn rises from high land at Dick Slack, and feeds two reservoirs on its six kilometre journey to Ripponden. It continues through Triangle to Sowerby Bridge where it joins the River Calder.
The area is characterised by deep valleys and high hills typical of the southern{Pennines.}Its beauty is the sharp contrast between hills and valleys and the magnificent views that these provide.
